messages.message:
Done a number of demos with insurers now on both claims and U/W use cases. Generally feedback on Build, Chat, and Converse is great. But to make it really powerful as an assistant it needs to come together. 

Live example - Nationwide is evaluating us for a claims coverage use case. Ideally the adjuster has the Build Output centrally in the screen with all the standard questions they want answered.

But is then able to query the same set of documents in Converse from the same window. Or ask a question to their chatbot on guidelines from the same window. They really work together for many use cases.

Build gets a lot of the standard stuff out in an automated flow whereas Converse and Chat allow for further querying on exceptions or anything that stands out cc @Kyra Harney
This almost sounds like human review + converse.
An idea that has been floated before.

Functionally, yes. But in this case we would not position it as human review. For complex information review, you'd never expect it to automatically flow through to another system. The "human review" window IS the main output, typically some form of summary. With Converse and Chat there to query the information further. And an ability to push it all out as a report. This applies to nearly every higher level information worker. M&A review, submission review, complex claim review etc
Just another validation point here @avi. The product team is looking into this area (as Bas you might already know) but good to hear this permutation as well

Great signal! I put a rough doc together a while ago but haven't had a chance to build on it yet, will take a stab sometime in next few weeks once chatbots launch is done. @Bas - I'm curious, at these insurers, would the adjusters usually see the build output/query the docs from their own ops tool? Or do we expect them to use our human review

PRD - Conversational Products in IDP - Google Docs (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1FsFS971Ma_m57lGUzFchuklRsl7BoVyoa1KTtOid_pY/edit)
